juniIpTunnelMIB.name: juniIpTunnelMIB

revisions.description: Replaced Unisphere names with Juniper names.
Initial version of this MIB module.

juniIpTunnelMIB.contactinfo: Juniper Networks, Inc. Postal: 10 Technology Park Drive Westford, MA 01886-3146 USA Tel: +1 978 589 5800 Email: mib@Juniper.net
juniIpTunnelMIB.description: The IP Tunnel MIB for the Juniper Networks enterprise.

juniIpTunnelNextIfIndex.name: juniIpTunnelNextIfIndex
juniIpTunnelNextIfIndex.description: Coordinate ifIndex value allocation for entries in juniIpTunnelIfTable. A GET of this object returns the next available ifIndex value to be used to create an entry in the associated interface table; or zero, if no valid ifIndex value is available. This object also returns a value of zero when it is the lexicographic successor of a varbind presented in an SNMP GETNEXT or GETBULK request, for which circumstance it is assumed that ifIndex allocation is unintended. Successive GETs will typically return different values, thus avoiding collisions among cooperating management clients seeking to create table entries simultaneously.

juniIpTunnelInterfaceTable.name: juniIpTunnelInterfaceTable
juniIpTunnelInterfaceTable.description: This table contains entries of IP Tunnel interfaces.

juniIpTunnelInterfaceEntry.name: juniIpTunnelInterfaceEntry
juniIpTunnelInterfaceEntry.description: Each entry describes the characteristics of a single IP Tunnel interface. Creating/deleting entries in this table causes corresponding entries for be created/deleted in ifTable/ifXTable/juniIfTable.

juniIpTunnelIfIndex.name: juniIpTunnelIfIndex
juniIpTunnelIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the IP tunnel interface. When creating entries in this table, suitable values for this object are determined by reading juniIpTunnelNextIfIndex.

juniIpTunnelName.name: juniIpTunnelName
juniIpTunnelName.description: The administratively assigned name for this IP Tunnel interface.

juniIpTunnelMode.name: juniIpTunnelMode
juniIpTunnelMode.description: The configured mode for this IP Tunnel interface.

juniIpTunnelVirtualRouter.name: juniIpTunnelVirtualRouter
juniIpTunnelVirtualRouter.description: The transport virtual router associated with this IP tunnel interface. This object need not be set when creating row entries. Note that the default when this object is not specified is the router associated with the agent acting on the management request.

juniIpTunnelChecksum.name: juniIpTunnelChecksum
juniIpTunnelChecksum.description: The Tunnel checksum configuration for this entry. Setting this object to true(1) will enabled end-to-end checksumming and will cause the system to drop packets with bad checksums received on this interface. Setting this object to false(2) will disable this feature. Note: This configuration object is not supported for DVMRP tunnels.

juniIpTunnelRowStatus.name: juniIpTunnelRowStatus
juniIpTunnelRowStatus.description: Controls creation/deletion of entries in this table according to the RowStatus textual convention, constrained to support the following values only: createAndGo destroy To create an entry in this table, the following entry objects MUST be explicitly configured: juniIpTunnelIfRowStatus juniIpTunnelName juniIpTunnelMode In addition, when creating an entry the following condition must hold: A value for juniIpTunnelIfIndex must have been determined previously, typically by reading juniIpTunnelNextIfIndex. Once created, the following objects may not be modified: juniIpTunnelName juniIpTunnelMode juniIpTunnelVirtualRouter A corresponding entry in ifTable/ifXTable/juniIfTable is created/ destroyed as a result of creating/destroying an entry in this table.

juniIpTunnelSequenceNumbers.name: juniIpTunnelSequenceNumbers
juniIpTunnelSequenceNumbers.description: The tunnel sequence number configuration for this entry. Setting this object to true(1) will enable sequence number generation. Setting this object to false(2) will disable this feature. Note: This configuration object is not supported for DVMRP tunnels.

juniIpTunnnelCompliance.name: juniIpTunnnelCompliance
juniIpTunnnelCompliance.description: Obsolete compliance statement for entities that implement the Juniper IP Tunnel MIB. This compliance statement became obsolete when juniIpTunnelSequenceNumbers was added.

juniIpTunnnelCompliance2.name: juniIpTunnnelCompliance2
juniIpTunnnelCompliance2.description: The compliance statement for entities that implement the Juniper IP Tunnel MIB.

juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup.name: juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup
juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup.description: Obsolete collection of objects for managing IP Tunnel capabilities in a Juniper product. This group became obsolete when juniIpTunnelSequenceNumbers was added.

juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup2.name: juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup2
juniIpTunnelInterfaceGroup2.description: A collection of objects for managing IP Tunnel capabilities in a Juniper product.
